books.title: Poetry
books.author: Thomas Gray
books.summary: A collection of poems by Thomas Gray.

books.title: Tarzan the Untamed
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: Tarzan embarks on a perilous journey through war-torn Africa to exact revenge against those who wronged him.

books.title: My Reminiscences
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Autobiographical sketches from the Bengali writer, poet, and artist Rabindranath Tagore.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Household Tales
books.author: Jacob Grimm
books.summary: A collection of Germanic fairy tales containing the classic stories of Cinderella, Snow-White, Rapunzel, and other well known characters.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Henry VI, Part III
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Henry VI is overthrown and Edward Plantagenet becomes the new King of England.

books.title: The Return
books.author: Walter de la Mare
books.summary: After visiting a graveyard, a man finds his appearance has mysteriously changed.

books.title: Downstream
books.author: Sigfrid Siwertz
books.summary: Five bourgeois Swedish siblings, linked by their ancestral home, attempt to forge different paths in life.

books.title: John Silence Stories
books.author: Algernon Blackwood
books.summary: A physician turned detective uses his psychic abilities to solve the strange cases presented to him.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.

books.title: The Big Four
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A famous detective must use all his little grey cells to stop an immensely powerful and ruthless organization from taking over the world.

books.title: Legends of Vancouver
books.author: E. Pauline Johnson
books.summary: E. Pauline Johnson’s collection of legends and myths of the Squamish people.

books.title: The Crock of Gold
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: A philosopher sets out to rescue the beautiful Caitilin Ni Murrachu from the god Pan in an adventure that involves leprechauns, Celtic gods, policemen, and philosophical disquisitions both profound and absurd.

books.title: The Book of Jade
books.author: David Park Barnitz
books.summary: A collection of decadent poetry by David Park Barnitz.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Henry Kuttner
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Henry Kuttner, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Just So Stories
books.author: Rudyard Kipling
books.summary: A collection of short humorous fables for children, most purporting to tell the origin of animal characteristics such as the camel’s hump.

books.title: Siddhartha
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.summary: A man embarks on a spiritual journey through India.

books.title: Letters Written During a Short Residence in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Mary Wollstonecraft’s account of her travels through Scandinavia.
